::Shadow Wing::

"Yeah, well, my rare spark could have gotten you killed today if that 
pred had some back." She looked at him."But thank you for the kind 
words. But I don't think I'm going to make any difference in this 
war. I'd just end up getting killed or someone else killed. You saw 
me react when you had me in the forest. I forgot my spark, and you 
had me pinned. It just proves that...that I'm not..." she couldn't 
finish the sentance.  She felt the words get caught in her throat.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> "A good spark is always the deciding factor in a war. There's 
always 
> soldiers, but a good spark is the rare thing. It takes years, 
> centuries,maybe even milleniums to end a war, and it's always 
> something with a good spark that ends it."-
>
